title: Parents launch methanol warning campaign after Laos tragedy | 7NEWS
description: The parents of Australian teenagers Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones, who died from methanol poisoning in Laos during their gap year, have launched a national campaign warning other schoolies about contaminated alcohol dangers. The 19-year-old best friends were fatally poisoned after being served tainted alcohol at their youth hostel, part of an incident that claimed six lives with no charges laid yet despite Foreign Minister Penny Wong pressing the Laos government 50 times for updates. title: House votes on releasing Epstein files | 7NEWS
description: The US House of Representatives is voting on a bipartisan bill to release the remaining Jeffrey Epstein files to the public. Donald Trump initially opposed the bill, calling it a 'democratic hoax', but dropped his opposition two days ago after mounting pressure from his own party members. Victims of Epstein, including family members of Virginia Dufresne who took her own life in Australia earlier this year, are present to witness the vote. title: Epstein files to be released to the public
description: The US House of Representatives has voted in favour of releasing the remaining Epstein files to the public, after US President Donald Trump's backflip on the bill, saying he has nothing to hide. #epsteinfiles #uspolitics #vote #trump #potus

title: Google CEO issues stark AI warning
description: The CEO of Alphabet, Google's parent company, Sundar Pichai has warned no company will be immune if the AI bubble bursts. #google #ai #alphabet #warning #investment

title: Thousands impacted after global tech outage
description: An internal system failure at Cloudflare, a web-infrastructure company, prevented thousands from accessing major internet platforms, including X and ChatGPT. #cloudflare #tech #outage #internet #globaloutage

title: Road rage incident caught on camera
description: A man has jumped onto the bonnet of a car during a road rage attack in Mildura in regional Victoria. #roadrage #dashcam #road #mildura #victoria

title: Sydney drivers could pay two-way toll on Harbour Bridge
description: Sydney drivers could soon be slugged with a two-way toll on the Harbour Bridge to help pay for the $60 weekly cap. #sydney #sydneyharbour #sydneyharbourbridge #tolls #nswpol

title: 'Parasocial' named Cambridge Dictionary's word of the year
description: Do you feel a one-sided connection with someone who doesn't know you? "Parasocial" refers to that exact phenomenon, and it's been named Cambridge Dictionary's word of the year. #parasocial #wordoftheyear #celebrity #taylorswift #traviskelce

title: Tropical Cyclone forms off NT coast
description: Tropical Cyclone Fina has formed northeast of Darwin. 7NEWS meteorologist Tony Auden explains when the system is expected to make landfall and how intense it will be for NT residents. #tcfina #cyclone #tropicalcyclone #weather #meteorology

title: Busking locations set up in Sydney CBD after council bans performers from certain areas
description: Should buskers be allowed to perform anywhere in the city, or should they have designated spots? The City of Sydney council is reconsidering its ban on performers setting up in parts of the CBD, as the state government sets up new busking locations in areas including Barangaroo, The Rocks and Darling Harbour. #busker #busking #music #performer #sydney

title: Epstein files set for release after congress passes bill | 7NEWS
description: The U.S. Congress has passed legislation requiring the release of all Jeffrey Epstein investigative files, with the bill now awaiting Donald Trump's signature. Once signed, the Department of Justice will have 30 days to release documents including travel records and internal communications, though victim identities and ongoing investigations will remain protected. Survivors and their families, who have fought for years for transparency, attended the congressional proceedings as this landmark legislation moved forward. title: Ultra-processed foods dominate Australian diets | 7NEWS
description: Ultra-processed foods comprise nearly half of the Australian diet and are linked to escalating rates of chronic disease, according to new research. These industrially made foods contain emulsifiers, gums, artificial colours and flavours that make them highly palatable and difficult to stop consuming. Over 100 global studies consistently show strong associations between high consumption of ultra-processed foods and obesity, chronic diseases, depression and other mental health issues. title: Princess of Wales returns with childhood care speech | 7NEWS
description: The Princess of Wales delivered her first public speech since her cancer diagnosis at a business summit in London, addressing corporate leaders about investing in early childhood care. She spoke about restoring dignity to the world of caring and loving well to build a healthier society. The event was part of her campaign to raise awareness about the importance of building healthy family relationships. title: New laws target Nazi displays and workplace harm | 7NEWS
description: New South Wales introduces laws banning Nazi ideology displays, including chants and slogans, with penalties of up to two years jail or $22,000 fines near synagogues and Jewish schools. A Sydney luxury apartment building controversies arise as affordable housing tenants for essential workers must use separate entrances and cannot access amenities like pools and gyms. Victoria joins New South Wales in making workplace gossip that causes psychological harm illegal from December. title: Sally Bowrey interviews Lenny Kravitz on legendary rocker's tour of Australia
description: Legendary rocker Lenny Kravitz sits down exclusively with Sally Bowrey on his tour of Australia. See the full interview on 7NEWS at 6pm. #lennykravitz #rock #music #entertainment #australia
